Images.Name: i0
Images.Description: Colon Adenocarcinoma - Gaglia et al, 2018 - Case 1

Waypoints.Name: The Waypoint
Waypoints.Description:
Representative t-CyCIF staining of a colon adenocarcinoma lesion and adjacent normal colon epithelium stitched together using the Ashlar software from 480 successive fields using a 20X/0.8NA objective.

#### Figure from:

Gaglia G et al, 2018 submitted

Waypoints.Name: Whole Tissue Overview
Waypoints.Description: The specimen is stained with a panel of markers comprising of cell type markers (keratin, CDX2, CD45 and aSMA) and protein stress markers (HSF1, Hsp27, Hsp70 and Hsp90).

Waypoints.Name: Normal Epithelium
Waypoints.Description:
The normal epithelium is recognizable by
the distinct tissue morphology with
organized structures staining positive
for keratin and alpha smooth muscle
actin (SMA).

The cells in the intestinal villi
express both keratin (blue) and CDX2 (red). The villi
are surrounded by stromal cells (green) and
immune cells (white) that at times
infiltrate the inner villus structure.

Waypoints.Name: Tumor tissue
Waypoints.Description:
The tumor tissue is characterized by
high levels of `CDX2` expression.

Waypoints.Name: Tumor tissue (cont.)
Waypoints.Description:
`HSF1` is also enriched in the tumor
tissue.

Waypoints.Name: HSF1 in foci
Waypoints.Description:
In spatially distinct part of the tumor
tissue HSF1 is found in nuclear
condensates. These `HSF1` foci are often
referred to as nuclear stress granules. 

The granules are thought to be a sign of
cells undergoing protein stress.

Waypoints.Name: Hsp70 and Hsp90 chaperones
Waypoints.Description:
The `Hsp70` (green) and `Hsp90` (red)
chaperones are fundamental for
maintaining cellular protein
homeostasis. `HSF1`  is one of the
transcription factors regulating the
expression of these key chaperone
proteins.

Waypoints.Name:
HSF1 foci are not correlated with
chaperone protein expression.
Waypoints.Description:
Surprisingly the presence of `HSF1` foci
is not positively  correlated with
higher expression of chaperone proteins.

In some instances in fact the presence
of HSF1 foci are strongly
anti-correlated with chaperone proteins.
